example[0]: A normal working week is 40 hours.
example[1]: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
example[2]: All I want is to lead a normal life.
example[3]: Her room was untidy, but that was quite normal.
example[4]: It’s normal to feel nervous before an exam.
note[1]: it is normal (for somebody) to do something
definition[1]: someone who is normal is mentally and physically healthy and does not behave strangely
example[5]: He seems a perfectly normal little boy.
example[6]: They can’t be normal to do something like that.
example[7]: The test results came back, and everything was completely normal.
example[8]: Her reaction to the news was perfectly normal.
example[9]: He sounded quite normal when he phoned.
example[10]: His family all seem pretty normal.
example[11]: All I want is to lead a happy, normal life.
example[12]: John and Liz were late as normal.
example[13]: Under normal circumstances, you would have to pay to go into the exhibition.
example[14]: The results will be posted to you in the normal way.
definition[2]: usual, typical, and as you would expect it to be
example[15]: Is this cold weather normal for the time of year?
example[16]: It had been another normal working day in the office.
definition[3]: not special, unusual, or different from normal
example[17]: They lived in an ordinary three-bedroomed house.
example[18]: It looks like an ordinary car, but it uses solar power.
example[19]: Would you like a regular salad or a Caesar salad?
example[20]: I just want an ordinary bicycle, not a mountain bike.
definition[4]: around the usual level or amount
example[22]: He is of above average intelligence.
example[23]: The average price of a pint of milk has gone up.
definition[5]: normal – used about methods of doing something, or about the size, shape, features etc of products
example[24]: It’s standard practice to X-ray hand-baggage at most airports.
example[25]: We stock shoes in all the standard sizes.
definition[6]: used about things that are done regularly as part of a series of things
example[26]: The fault was discovered during a routine check of the plane.
example[27]: routine tasks such as shopping and cooking
definition[7]: used about things that happen or that you use as part of normal life
example[28]: He painted scenes of everyday life in France.
example[29]: Sally was still dressed in her everyday clothes.
definition[8]: used about birds and plants that are of the most usual type, and in the phrase the common people (=people who are not rich and powerful)
example[31]: an alliance between the aristocracy and the common people
definition[9]: of the kind that is usually used – used when comparing this with a different or special type
example[32]: The engine is more efficient than a conventional diesel engine.
example[33]: the drugs used in conventional medicine
example[34]: conventional weapons (=not nuclear, chemical, or biological)
definition[10]: the usual state, level, or amount
example[36]: Thankfully, train services are now back to normal.
example[37]: Slowly her heartbeat returned to normal.
example[38]: Car sales are still below normal for the time of year.
example[39]: The journey took longer than normal.
